website_summaries.verdict: Offers a solid design that's suitable for avid outdoor enthusiasts, military, and police personnel. However, it could be too much for those who want a basic tool.
pros: A solidly constructed multi-tool with 16 components, including 2 durable SOG Assisted Technology blades that open quickly and lock into place for effortless, one-handed cutting
cons: Heavier than most, at more than 14 ounces
Some users find tools too large and too powerful for basic tasks

customer_reviews.title: Look elsewhere, this is the worst tool I have ever had.
customer_reviews.text: After 3 years of use, I have found this multitool to be subpar to the Leatherman and Gerber tools I have owned. The blade lock function is easily defeated, a coworker of mine was injured due to this. The bolts and nuts, holding it all together are prone to being stripped and ineffective from the manufacturer. I did research before ordering this tool, and was impressed with everything I read. I would not recommend this tool or brand, it is not safe to use.
customer_reviews.author: Dale

customer_reviews.title: Broken so soon, so easily. What a shame.
customer_reviews.text: I previously had the black anodized SOG power assist. That one lasted 4 years until the Brits confiscated it when I forgot it in my checked luggage. This one has barely lasted 2 months. What torture test did I put it through you ask? I grabbed the tip of a ballpoint pen with it, and the tip broke off on side of the pliers as pictured. I haven't really even begun to use this, and I'm terribly disappointed that the quality has diminished so much on my absolute favorite multi-tool. I'm hoping this was just a one-off defect, but it's pretty disheartening.
customer_reviews.author: RamZ27

customer_reviews.title: I have broken the tips of the pliers twice during that time and both times SOG has been great about warrantying it
customer_reviews.text: I have now been using this tool daily for 3 years. I have broken the tips of the pliers twice during that time and both times SOG has been great about warrantying it. The gear drive on the pliers gives you a lot of griping force and makes for a very smooth opening tool. Its very easy to flip the tool open with just one hand, different than your average leatherman. 3 years of hard use and it still performs great! I strongly recommend this tool if you are in the market for full sized, daily use, multitool. This is not a gimmicky tool, its solid, practical, and meant to be used.
customer_reviews.author: David Z.

customer_reviews.title: Exactly What It Says On The Tin
customer_reviews.text: So many products promise but rarely deliver. This is a solidly built multitool which feels great in your hand. All are very useable tools which one would/could use in real life day to day scenarios. Perfect as an EDC. Comes with a proper pouch that fits snugly. The power assist is well cool, makes torqing bolts/nuts childsplay. A lot of bang for your buck. This is a keeper. Everyone should own one. Exactly what it says on the tin. (In this case, the box)
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Better than leatherman
customer_reviews.text: this will last me about a year before i send it back for repair. I was sending my leather man tools back twice a year at least because of failures. It’s not perfect but I like it. The wire cutters could be more hardened. Don’t cut anything other than soft copper or aluminum. The safety / lock features on the blades take getting used to. That’s about it
customer_reviews.author: Jonnyboy

customer_reviews.title: Could he better, could be worse.
customer_reviews.text: Not too impressed for the price. The 2 assisted blades being able to open without having to open the pliers are a great idea. I barely cut any wires, pretty thin too, but the cutters are dinged up already. Some of the other parts needed adjustment. Overall, pretty good, but I should have spend the extra money on the Leatherman that has replacement cutters.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Brittle Blades and Sloppy Pliers
customer_reviews.text: Less than a year in and the tips of the pliers have chipped off under minimal force. The knives don't hold an edge. Feels nice in your hand though. The pliers have also developed a great deal of slop making them useless for fine tasks. Overall it's been very useful but I would not purchase something from. SOG again
customer_reviews.author: J Robertson

customer_reviews.title: Good multi-tool with a few flaws.
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to get the middle tools out without pulling all of them. Wire cutter not replaceable. But much cheaper than the equivalent Leatherman.
customer_reviews.author: Cesar H. Perez

customer_reviews.title: SOG dropped their quality big time
customer_reviews.text: I gave this 2 stars due to the quality of the tool. I bought one of these many years ago and still have it. When comparing them side by side the new one is much thinner, cheaper metal. Everything from the screw drivers to the pliers to the assisted opening knifes. It is very cheap. Don't expect the assisted opening knifes to be assisted. It has a spring, but not like the old one. 50% of the time you have to manually open the knife. Overall, not too impressed, but it will do what I need it to do.
customer_reviews.author: APR

customer_reviews.title: Great multitool
customer_reviews.text: Awesome tool! I use this thing every week. Very durable. I did have to wipe it down when it arrived to remove the oil it was packed in....no big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Davis

customer_reviews.title: Just not less than 5 star.
customer_reviews.text: I have Lethermann - but got SOG as a gift . Use my Leatherman for 5 years - but this one is not less.. Very good quality . plus the price is 3 times less. So will recommend this multitool to everyone. Really not less than most expansive Leatherman model of multitool
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Z.

customer_reviews.title: JUNK TOOL
customer_reviews.text: I bought this sog tool instead of a leatherman because i liked the design. Big mistake! This is Taiwan made junk. It is going back to amazon and i am buying leatherman.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Opening it to reveal the pliers is really cool, its smooth and just amazing how the "gears" ...
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely a high quality multi-tool and the weight of it is just right. Opening it to reveal the pliers is really cool, its smooth and just amazing how the "gears" turn. The knives were a bit stiff to open at first but I suspect they will become smooth over time. I used to have a Gerber before(gave it away) and decided to try SOG because of the reviews. I can tell this this product will last many years. The box also says assembled in the USA which is great not to mention it has a lifetime warranty. Glad to support American jobs!
customer_reviews.author: J.Black

customer_reviews.title: Not so perfect now
customer_reviews.text: It's bigger than most Multi Tools but it's do awesome of a tool! The blades are razor sharp and the tools are somewhat stiff but it's so swesome! --update on use after 2 months:-- I tried to cut some steel commo wire and it slightly dented the cutters together so it "sticks" between opening and closing. Still works but it's annoying. If they could add a small insert on its wire-cutting edge it'd be perfect. For now I went instead with the SOG Switch Plier. I'd like to keep carrying this beautiful work of art but it's not 100% anymore. I don't even know how I can fix it.
customer_reviews.author: MacGrandPa

customer_reviews.title: One of the latch for a tool doesn't work...
customer_reviews.text: Amazing multiple tools and knives from SOG again. However, I am giving 3 stars because one of the latch to hold screw driver does not work anymore. The screw driver tool does not stay standing because the latch does not properly latch. Disappointing for the craftsmen on this product. I am gonna contact customer service to see if they can replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing
customer_reviews.text: What a BEAST of a multitool! I love this thing! It has most of the tools you need handily available, and the pliers (the most important part of the tool, in my opinion) can be opened about like a balisong. I find myself just flipping it open and shut, open and shut...also, the compound leveraging gives you enough grip strength to hold onto pretty much anything you want (hopefully not your finger). You also get two spring-assisted blades on the outside of the closed tool. It doesn't get much better than this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You wont be disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: What a great multi-tool! I love this thing, opening is so smooth and balanced. The plier grips are perfectly machined. All the multi-tools open out without ripping your finger nails off. The open assist on both knife blades is an awesome addition. I like the Leatherman multi-tool but this is definitly a notch above in functionality. Im glad it was recommended to me.
customer_reviews.author: Cecilio Mulleda

customer_reviews.title: Longer handle but nice features
customer_reviews.text: The power assist gears make this a longer handled tool by about and inch. It's a nice feather, but makes the tool larger than what I'm used to from past multi-tools I've owner. It's a great all-around tool and the blades come sharp. The "toolbox" feature keeps all the "tool" attachments tucked away under a cover and so you don't get a lot of the typical rubbing on the hand that comes from a multi-tool when you're using the pliers. The two blades still do, but it's minimized. Everything locks into place which is another nice feature as you don't have things trying to fold up on you while using them.
customer_reviews.author: Hub

customer_reviews.title: YOU CAN'T BUY BETTER BUT YOU CAN PAY MORE!
customer_reviews.text: BEST THERE IS. FLAT OUT HANDS DOWN. YOU CANT CHOOSE BETTER BUT YOU CAN PAY MORE WITH A LEATHERMAN. THE FORCE MULTILIER GEARS GIVE MONSTER VISE LIKE POWER. THE MOMENT ITS IN YOUR HAND YOU "KNOW" YOU HAVE A MACHINE GRADE TOOL IN YOUR HANDS AND NOT SOME OTHER ORDINARY TOOL. A CALIBER ABOVE THE REST. EVERYTHING MADE TO PRECISE MEASUREMENTS AND TOLERANCES. THEIR WEBSITE COULD USE A TUNE UP THOUGH!
customer_reviews.author: Ronald D. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: SIMPLY A GREAT PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.text: I work in broadcast production, and this is my 2nd right hand. It does everything it has been advertised to do and is durable. When i first opened it, i thought it would perhaps be a little flimsy, not in the pliers part (that is built like a tank), but in the handle attachments. However they have been strong and dependable.I suggest reading the directions and getting a good feel for how it operates, so when you need it you are not fumbling about and know exactly where you need to be to operate all the tools.
customer_reviews.author: MOJO

customer_reviews.title: Great multi tool knife combo
customer_reviews.text: Great multi tool knife combo. It's a little bulky and tad bit heavier than I would have like. But overall I'm pretty satisfied with my SOG.
customer_reviews.author: Waesop Fables

customer_reviews.title: Simple and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I use this just about every day at my job. I’ve beaten it up pretty hard and it has held up great. The locking grip feature actually does work, great for getting out stripped screws. The knives being on the outside is also very convenient. I like that there aren’t 20+ tools crammed in this thing, only what you need. It is also very smooth opening and closing. Overall a great tool and I would buy it again!
customer_reviews.author: Davis

customer_reviews.title: Multitool
customer_reviews.text: A lot of different multi tools out there. Find the one that has the features you like. I like the Leatherman OHT, but chose this one for the file. SOGs seem durable and I like assisted opening. Wire cutter works well. I have not had to crimp a blasting cap yet.
customer_reviews.author: Blade Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Good tool, but expect a break in period.
customer_reviews.text: This tool is worth your money, but it doesn't get 5 stars from me due to the break-in I had to do on the two assisted-opening knife blades. It took a bit of CLP gun oil and a few hours playing with them (open and close, open and close) in order to get them functioning as smoothly as I expected them to be out of the box. Once that was done, however, I am thoroughly pleased with the tool. The grip is solid and comfortable when using the pliers. The blades are razor sharp. The tools work as hard as they should. This tool is worth the money and the break-in, but for 5 stars, the break-in wouldn't be necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Smith

customer_reviews.title: The cutters are nice
customer_reviews.text: This is pretty cool. The blades are fun to play with just because of the assisted open. Like others have said, the tools in the handle are hard to get to individually, and I have to use the back spring to get the screwdriver all the way out. However it's all worth it because the pliers on it are great. I can flip it open with one hand and the pliers will go through everything I need them to with relative ease. The knife is also pretty sharp out of the box on mine.
customer_reviews.author: Zapban

customer_reviews.title: First rate materials
customer_reviews.text: Heavy, carefully crafted, very well made. For someone looking for the best possible set of pliers on a multitool, this is the best choice. I found the power assisted blades not particularly advantageous, however -would have preferred more tools instead. Hard to access inside tools, although the v-cut tool is awesome. UPDATE May 16, 2013: The pliers are head and shoulders above any other multitool available in the market today, including the Spirit X by Victorinox, or the Wave and Charge TTi by Leatherman. They are professional grade, as good or better than a pair of dedicated pliers of the same size.
customer_reviews.author: Manuel Antonio Arce Arenales

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I have a few other multi-tools, all by big name companies, but the Sog is far and above the nicest. Don't be fooled by the shine, this is a tool. Sure it looks good, but to hold it in your hand, the fit and finish, the design, and just how it functions makes it worth the price. Nothing sticks, or needs "broke in", it is ready to go out of the box. The knife blades are razor sharp, REMEMBER this! I love the pliers, they are close tolerance, no gaps and match up nice when grabbing something very small.
customer_reviews.author: tin.man1962

customer_reviews.title: Robust
customer_reviews.text: Well built. Still getting used to it. Been using Gerber for years and years. Time will tell. Pouch only clips to belt rather than having to run belt through loop. Haven’t lost it yet though
customer_reviews.author: Colleen Kornkven

customer_reviews.title: Glad I bought it and look forward to keeping closer ...
customer_reviews.text: The SOG PowerAssist Multi-Tool S66N-CP is really top notch. Had not used much before today. It is really tuned and effective in many uses. Glad I bought it and look forward to keeping closer to hand and using it more often. It is well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: John R. Hawkins

customer_reviews.title: if only you had instructions
customer_reviews.text: I was going through the process of returning this to Amazon. As I thought it was defective and would not deploy the knife blades properly. I then had an idea and went to the Internet and found several videos that showed how to use all the tools on this power assist. Once properly instructed by a third-party I started to like this tool. In quality and in functionality it lies between A victorinox and leatherman. Because of SOG's total lack of any documentation on either its uses or warranty info. I can only give it three stars
customer_reviews.author: Craigln

customer_reviews.title: Strong design
customer_reviews.text: I have had Leathermen tools for years but I also have the first series multi tool SOG made and now this power assist. Leathermen is still a better tool but for the price point this is hard to beat. I feel SOG spent to much time on the power assist and missed the mark on the amount of tools needed for a good multi tool. The power assist is more a pain then a help do we really need a fast opening blade on a multi tool? A saw blade and good scissors would have been better.
customer_reviews.author: Robert DeGeare

customer_reviews.title: quality knife
customer_reviews.text: I wish the philips head locked in place. All of the other tools do. I love the knife for every other reason. The spring assist is really nice but didn't shoot out the knife like I was expecting. I have no trouble opening it up with one hand though after a tiny bit of practice, which is all that's important. I like the choice of a serrated or straight blade. It's a little bit of a letdown how the spring assist gets ride of any tools on one side of knife but at least you can customize the ones you do have if you're really picky. I have already used this every day at my two jobs.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Bongard

customer_reviews.title: Great multitool
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the sog power assist for work. I'm a plumber by trade. I've found the assisted blades very useful. The smooth finish is easy to clean. My only gripe would be the case. I'm not a fan of the plastic clip so I ordered a leather case for it. All in all a great multitool.
customer_reviews.author: andrew brown

customer_reviews.title: you decide
customer_reviews.text: Have used them for a while and so far they are rock solid great tool just a little hard to use the internal tools but Pliers and knives are really easy to use but there are some things I don't like 1 the blade doesn't hold edge really well 2 internal tools are hard to take out. And some times you try to take one our and 2 or 3 come out 3 the locking mechanism of the blades is a little hard to unlock the blades from the open position.
customer_reviews.author: Federico S.

customer_reviews.title: Sweet sweet action
customer_reviews.text: I got it a month ago and haven't used it yet. I don't think I'll ever use it! It's so beautiful and so well built, it looks like a piece of art. All I do is take it out of the sheath, play with it and put it back in. The action on the pliers is so smooth and sweet. It opens and closes like butter. I just can't get enough!!
customer_reviews.author: Ziv Tzadok

customer_reviews.title: A+ product. Would not trade it for another!
customer_reviews.text: I would not trade my Power Assist for any other Multi-tool. The gear system adds tremendous strength to the plyers. The plyers also comes to a sharp point and are close enough to pull out splinters. The blades come razor sharp. The only thing you want to be careful about is the way the knives are deployed. Since the knives are assisted, they have a tendency to catch the ends of your fingers. This product works well when wearing gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: The knife and saw work are super sharp. The locking mechanism is also really nifty. It locks in place both when it's open and when it's closed. It has enough tools to be really useful but not to the point where it gets bulky and unmanageable. I live in a condo and keep this tool in my unit and my toolbox down in storage. It works great for the little jobs around the house and given it's weight I expect it to perform well for camping and backpacking this summer.
customer_reviews.author: Marina R Skowronski

customer_reviews.title: Very nice pliers
customer_reviews.text: I bought these mainly for the pliers which is what I would use most on them. Because of the gear action they are stronger than other multi tool pliers I've tried. They also have a smaller needlepoint and a longer wire cutter. The v cutter works good for striping wires. I also like the assisted action of the 2 blades. The only thing I would change is to add a belt clip to the multi tool. It has one attached to the casting case but it would be more usable for me the other way.
customer_reviews.author: Sam McMillen

customer_reviews.title: The PowerAssist is nice. The compound leverage feature is awesome
customer_reviews.text: The PowerAssist is nice. The compound leverage feature is awesome. The edged tools are really sharp out of the box. I wish it had a pair of scissors but I knew it did now when I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Ike

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE this multitool
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this multitool, I've used it for years as a military medic. The cams that give extra power to the pliers are fantastic and are always smooth, all the tool components are great quality, easy to utilize, and there's nothing I don't need added on. I knocked a star off THIS review because I purchased one as a gift for somebody and upon opening the shipping box the product's actual packaging was all taped together, it looks like it was completely ripped open then taped together. Everything was there, and it's a minor gripe....but it was a gift and kind of makes it look crappy now.
customer_reviews.author: spookyu

customer_reviews.title: Different tools than pictured
customer_reviews.text: The tool is a very good product, but instead of the phillips head screwdriver in the photo, it has a tool for punching a hole in a block of C-4 explosive. I had to go to the SOG web site to figure out what it was. Oh yeah and it has a blasting cap crimper too. It has a can opener but not a bottle opener. No V Cutter as mentioned in the description, but a file, that isn't bad a file is useful. I really don't need a C-4 tool I do need a Phillips. Not sure if I am going to return it or not. Be careful as what they sent wasn't what they described!
customer_reviews.author: Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: My second one
customer_reviews.text: I've had the black oxide version power-assist, for almost two years. I use at work daily and it has been exceptional, a real 'working' tool. I wanted the satin or 'shiny' version for non work edc. There are smaller, lighter multitools out there, but in a real emergency, I just could not trust anything else. One hand opening, built like a tank, replaceable components, lifetime warranty, and, it's just plain cool. It's a crazy world people, be as prepared for the unexpected as you can be.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Smooth and useful tool.
customer_reviews.text: Move over swiss army knives, this multi tool has you beat easily. Very easy to open and operate, especially with spring assisted knife and saw blade. After using this for a few days it felt like second nature. Great tool for the under $60 price tag and would recommend over Gerber.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Anderson

customer_reviews.title: These are really nicely made and heavy
customer_reviews.text: These are really nicely made and heavy, I had to return because they were so heavy they would cause my pants to pull down, but that's no reason to deduct any stars as it was more my problem. The assisted blades if a bit iffy in deploying, the placement of the thumb studs just seemed awkward to me.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Farquhar

customer_reviews.title: Nice tool
customer_reviews.text: Multi-tool is good, high quality. However the tool busted through the packaging (probably during shipping). This was a gift so it was annoying.
customer_reviews.author: C89

customer_reviews.title: Vise Grip locking plier force
customer_reviews.text: After years of using Leatherman products which are great, I came across this and what interested me the most was the leverage thing on the pliers, since I use it a lot. Well this thing is absolutely great. The grip power is amazing it is as if you hold a Vise Grip locking pliers. For those who uses the plier a lot and need a grip power, this is the tool.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great quality
customer_reviews.text: this thing is bullet proof it is heavy but made well it is comfortable and i love the case it clips onto the belt instead of having to slide it all the way around your belt before putting it on. and yes the clip is very secure! only had one issue with this and that was my Phillips head wouldn't stay locked out. took out the bit and looked at the notch where the piano key locks into and it just wasn't quite right but 5 minutes with a file and it is perfect now!
customer_reviews.author: alex shaw

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: It truly is an amazing multi-tool one that can cut straight through most gauge wire with ease. The gear system on it makes it extremely powerful compared to most multi-tools that I have used. I would definitely recommend this product. The biggest drawback is the fact that you are very limited in tools. I mean don't get me wrong it can get the job done, it just doesn't have as many as I would like to see on a multi-tool.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse James

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: I am buying this one as a replacement for the one I lost to TSA. I have been using this model for about 5 years and I love it , especially the V-cut.
customer_reviews.author: Shamondo Sharpless

customer_reviews.title: Get something else
customer_reviews.text: The main spacer between the knifes is plastic and when knife is in open position it wobbles too much. This is not a seriouse tool. Two stars for looking pretty.
customer_reviews.author: NK

customer_reviews.title: but I liked this one a little more
customer_reviews.text: I had already owned the black oxide version, but I liked this one a little more.The tool doesn't need to be cleaned as thoroughly upon receiving and the Phillips head only locks at 180 degrees.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Multi-tool
customer_reviews.text: This multi-tool is rugged and gets the job done. It doesn't have a spring action for the pliers, which took some getting used to. Everything is high quality and the blades held up nicely. I had the serrated blade snap on a job, I called SOG's customer service and learned I had to pay for shipping to the company. SOG replaced my all my blades and the pliers free of charge and no questions asked. They had it back to me in a week and they paid the return shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Clark E.

customer_reviews.title: I really like this nife have the esential tools you need + ...
customer_reviews.text: I really like this nife have the esential tools you need + have a very nice desing and the security sistem is very good. What i like the most is the gear mechanism to open and close the knife is very soft. leatherman is also one of my favorites but sog is very good too.
customer_reviews.author: MIGUEL MIRANDA

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Best multi tool I have purchased I work in construction at a local telecom company so I do use it daily I have had leatherman and gerber and like them but this sog is the best for me I love the knives easy to sharpen and stay sharp I even carry it as my daily carry
customer_reviews.author: Lee Hanberg

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality Multi-Tool
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I like this multi-tool. The one-handed works pretty much as advertised. The multi-tool has just the right amount of tools, without sacrificing the quality of any one tool. I would recommend this tool to anyone who's looking for a quality tool in the 40-70 dollars.
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: Nice Multi
customer_reviews.text: I really like the quality, it shows. I must admit it isn't light, but none of the strong Multi Tools are. I have a bunch of them. The torque and cutting power is great. Although my comparable from China is even heavier. Overall I like SOG product and have some of their other sharper goodies as well.
customer_reviews.author: sig1ms

customer_reviews.title: SOG
customer_reviews.text: Chose this to replace a well worn Craftsman for usage at both home and work. Has performed well. Have experienced the flip cover that covers the other tools coming off when opened but this is not a major problem. Was easily reattached and am more careful when opening tool. Do like the "Power Assist" pliers and the locking knife blade and file. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: cg3

customer_reviews.title: Very good product
customer_reviews.text: Although geared pliers are powerful and have great utility, they occasionally pinch your palm when being used for heavy cutting and crimping. Also the bottle openers have obviously never been tried on beer bottles..Corona et al. Overall a great tool, definitely more sturdy, hence more useful than a Leatherman. Wouldn't trade. Also warranty service is 2nd to none
customer_reviews.author: Gil S.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice and built tough!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Got these for the groomsman in my wedding. I have a leatherman wave, and this one is much bigger, and the pliers with the gearing work as intended! the knives flip out SOG style as well (with the spring assisted open) I take one star off, because I wish they had it in black. Being in military and police work, black is almost a must...
customer_reviews.author: Emir

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!
customer_reviews.text: SOG is the only way to go when it comes to knives and multitools. I have the S66N and the Twitch XL, both are made of excellent quality and durability.Just purchased the s66. Ive had the Twitch XL for a couple years now and use it all the time, assisted opening still works perfect and blade is still rigid... no wobble or loosening. SOGs products are at the top in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding multi-tool. Best on the market for everyday use.
customer_reviews.text: This SOG multi-tool is not only everything you need but also in high demand overseas. Every military person in the world wants one of these but cannot get their hands on them. This is my second one this year due to gift exchanges with our ISAF partners. These tools are the best on the market.
customer_reviews.author: A. Reyes

customer_reviews.title: Well built , Heavy and Handy Multi tool.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this on a trip to replace a 10 Year old Leather Man Wave based on amazon reviews. The Tool has good balance and is well built. It is heavy and has safety features to lock the sharp accessories. Hopefully this should give a few years of general handy usage.
customer_reviews.author: gumsbubba

customer_reviews.title: Can't go anywhere without my SOG
customer_reviews.text: I have been in construction for years.Had every multitool known and the SOG is my favorite.Made tough and rust resistant.If it breaks SOG will fix it free.It's a tool for all people in construction industry.A definite tool for anyone in maintenance.The tool speaks for itself.
customer_reviews.author: Kara C

customer_reviews.title: The knife for all your needs
customer_reviews.text: This utility multitool is the best. Much stronger than my Swiss army. It's great for keeping in your car or take it along with you while biking and camping. The only down side is the large size. 4 5/8" (L) x 1 5/8" (W) and weight, not for everyday carrying. The good news is that it comes with a nylon pouch and a belt clip.
customer_reviews.author: RSL

customer_reviews.title: Nice... But...
customer_reviews.text: Ok... So the SOG is a very nice tool. The Power Assist blade is nice... but unless you're ambidextrous, you will only be able to use one or the other comfortably (serrated or smooth blade). Also, a little rough on the hands because of the squared off design. All in all... I like it. All in all... I recommend it...
customer_reviews.author: Islandero

customer_reviews.title: ... I've gone through a couple of them but my favorite multi-tool by far
customer_reviews.text: I wish the steal was a little harder as I've gone through a couple of them but my favorite multi-tool by far! Used every day for years.
customer_reviews.author: Bytes

customer_reviews.title: Best father's day gift I ever received!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this tool for about 7 years and expect it to be the last one I wool ever need. Great workmanship and built to last. I bought and gave it to my wife, who in turn gave it too my kids to give to me for father's day...best father's day gift I ever received...LOL.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love all that this tool has to offer
customer_reviews.text: I am a firefighter and carry this with me. Love all that this tool has to offer. No complaints at all.
customer_reviews.author: Ty

customer_reviews.title: Nice and functional
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tool after reading how well they were made and how functional they are. I love how strong the pliers are and how you can customize the tools. You can add different ones and remove others. I keep one handy just about everywhere. I have one in each of my backpacks and in my cars. You never know when you will need to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazon and SOG Multitool great combo
customer_reviews.text: Finally a multitool by SOG that has replaceable parts and is easy to open without having to struggle to get at the part you need. Also having access to the cutting blades w/o opening the rest of the unit is a great improvement. Oh yes using the wire cutter w/o having to open the pliers all the way is a practical feature. Great Tool.
customer_reviews.author: B Z

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tool
customer_reviews.text: Love it! This is my second one. The first one being a gift. I just had to get one for myself. Quality tool(s). You won't be disappointed. I also ordered from SOG some different tools that you can change. Very sturdy also.
customer_reviews.author: GeriZ

customer_reviews.title: A great piece, a little difficult to use.
customer_reviews.text: This IS a high quality piece. However, it is very complex to use. Everything is held in place so well, that it requires very good strength to use everything. But the learning curve is well worth the effort. I have several brands of these, this one is about the best.
customer_reviews.author: owl9704a

customer_reviews.title: This thing's a hoss....
customer_reviews.text: Slightly larger than the Leatherman and the Gerber tools that I own. Seems to be well made, although I haven't had a chance to put it through the paces yet. It has a locking mechanism on the two knife blades that I find a bit cumbersome, though. Smooth operation, nice, solid feel, pleasing to the eye, as well.
customer_reviews.author: D. R. Coulter

customer_reviews.title: SOG powerassist
customer_reviews.text: I was really satisfied with SOG powerassist, looked and performed just like the videos that SOGknives.com provided. It's easily a better buy than a Leatherman considering all of the practical innovations that don't quite set in until you try it out. Not to mention my order came in almost a week early with free shipping which is a first since I live in Hawaii.
customer_reviews.author: Lincoln Osiris

customer_reviews.title: I do a lot of electrical work so the wire stripping hook is an awesome and unique tool you dont find in others
customer_reviews.text: I take this with me everywhere. This is the 2nd one I've bought. Lasts for about 2 years, probably 3 or 4 if you don't get sand in it. I do a lot of electrical work so the wire stripping hook is an awesome and unique tool you dont find in others. Majority of the time I use the knives and needle nose pliers. The difference between these geared plier and regular non geared pliers is VERY noticeable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: S 66-N
customer_reviews.text: This knife/tool is larger than the last sog I've had. I'm replacing the last one because I broke the pliers ends but I used 2 hands and all my might to do that and I'm a big man. This is a rather complex tool with ~ 40 pieces of metal put together like a Swiss watch. I wish it had the scissors and the awl instead of the medium flat-head screwdriver and file. but I knew what it had when I bought it so it get's all 5 *'s
customer_reviews.author: Wcarlpdrysdale

customer_reviews.title: Use everyday
customer_reviews.text: Already have two and use one every day , best made
customer_reviews.author: David A. Brewer

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: Pros - superb design, quality metal, takes a beating Cons - If you really need to squeeze like mad on these you may need gloves, clips every kind of wire I've put in it, can't hold up to guitar strings but not much can, I wish it had a #2 philips screw driver instead of a #1
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Very Good, but not Excellent.
customer_reviews.text: An amazing pocket tool. Summary below. Pros: +Very high quality materials. +Very high quality finishing. +Leverage assisted technology works very well. +Lock/Unlock features very handy. Cons: +Not very compact (has a lot of empty spaces). +Could have extra tools, such as scissors .
customer_reviews.author: ck

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous
customer_reviews.text: Had one of these and lost it and had to get another ! They have lots of good points but two of the best are the (1) power assist needle nose pliers and (2) the additional tools and blades that you are order and arrange to your needs. Great item - I really recomend this one.
customer_reviews.author: R. Merck

customer_reviews.title: a great long lasting tool.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this tool for a while now and I still love it. Smooth action with the pliers and they're teeth are so tight that they could act as tweezers. Both knives still flip out very easily too. The best multi-tool I've owned.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing. Assisted knife opening and it is super smooth.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good but cumbersome to use after the OHT. I returned it and got another OHT.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Versatile and guaranteed...
customer_reviews.text: Options for design make this the right tool for many. I broke a part and service replaced it immediately. Thanks for an excellent product. I have bought these for a few as gifts.
customer_reviews.author: John Moorhouse

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: Love this tool use it every day better value then my leathermen supertool
customer_reviews.author: jim Graham

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value for money and very well made
customer_reviews.text: Excellent value for money and very well made, especially when put alongside some of the other brand name multi-tools out there (two of which I own). The easy opening mechanism and levered pliers definitely standout, this is a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Valtenbergs

customer_reviews.title: Now I'm ready for anything
customer_reviews.text: This versatile tool is very well built. I bought it to keep in my car. The quality is above what I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Bill King

customer_reviews.title: I’m blown away by this thing!
customer_reviews.text: Seriously cool tool! Without a doubt the best multi tool on the market. Heavy, sturdy and top notch.
customer_reviews.author: Jon L Davies

customer_reviews.title: Great Multi-tool
customer_reviews.text: This multi-tool is amazing. The assisted blade opens up very fast with only the slightest amount of pressure at the right angle. I've already used the easy access knife in so many occasions because it is SO EASY to just flip out. The other tools inside work just as well and the compound leverage is something else. The ONLY problem I see with the tool is when you want to take the v cutter out it also brings out one of the can openers. You can put it back with the slightest pressure but its just a little annoying at times. NO BIGGY though. Definitely would recommend this to a friend. Already have.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice
customer_reviews.text: Took a little breaking in, but overall a very nice multi-tool. Spring assisted knives are handy and fun. Extra leverage from plier gears is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: The quality of the product.
customer_reviews.text: Quality. Every day out door use. I just ordered another one for shop use. It is rugged and has everything you need when you are away from your shop or home tools.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I have put mine through absolute hell, use it ...
customer_reviews.text: I have put mine through absolute hell, use it daily, and after being thought 5 Berbers, a couple leather mans, this one beats them all. You have to have the compound leverage ones though,worth the extra dough
customer_reviews.author: Cody P in SW VA

customer_reviews.title: Durability and strength
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the S66-N to replace a Gerber multitool that had seen better days. The SOG is heavier and thicker than the Gerber and it feels comfortable when in hand. The PowerAsssist does offer much more cutting and gripping strength than other multitools I have used. The blades are easily accessible and quick to draw and the locking mechanism seems very secure. I am quite happy with them so far and the only reason I have not given them 5 stars is that they are not as easy to use one handed as the Gerbers they replaced.
customer_reviews.author: MF

customer_reviews.title: Lifetime warranty came through!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this tool. I use it almost on a daily basis at work. After a year of hard use, I managed to snap the plier head in half while trying to bend a steel rod. I was devastated. I called SOG customer support and explained what happened and they sent me a brand new plier head quickly. The whole process was quick and easy! Back into my work pouch it goes! I definitely recommend this tool.
customer_reviews.author: Desmodus

customer_reviews.title: ... a year and a half ago and they worked fine except the plier tip broke off after a year
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my Stepdad a year and a half ago and they worked fine except the plier tip broke off after a year. Is there a way to replace this part?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for emergency services use.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product and very well constructed. The tool is large framed but that is what I wanted. I feel like it's gonna be a winner for sure!! Very fast shipping as usual.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Hughes

customer_reviews.title: They sure like American made products
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these as presents for family in the Philippines. They sure like American made products. Consider them way above what they usually get there from China. Well built, I want one now.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Great multitool!
customer_reviews.text: A really nice feature of this multitool is that the blades can be used without opening it. Excellent quality material throughout. Won't hurt your hand to use the pliers.
customer_reviews.author: D Hopper

customer_reviews.title: SOG Multi-Tool, pretty nice...
customer_reviews.text: I'm going to be using the SOG as a work carry tool and keep my leatherman for non-work EDC. I prefer my Leatherman Charge TTi, but the SOG is a great tool also. Smoother operation of the pliers, the blade steel is ok, not S-30V like the Charge. Cuts well, grips very good, and if you don't have the money for a Leatherman, go with this, WAY better then a Gerber. I love the lock out system, but they need to rethink the blade release method it's hard to get your thumb to the post and get it released for assist open, it's well built, but the operation was just not very well thought out.
customer_reviews.author: -E

customer_reviews.title: This one is not for me
customer_reviews.text: I like SOG tools. I wanted a newer style with blade access without having to open the tool. This SOG has a great selection of tools as well. There were two major problems I had. The first is that there are knurled lock bars to lock open the blades These things are sharp! So sharp that it makes handling and holding the tool difficult at times. The second problem is the style of swing on the blades. There is a "hitch" in the middle of the arc as the blade opens and my finger kept slipping off the thumb stud and connecting with the blade edge. Ouch. This was repeatable and was also very annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn S.

product_meta.title: SOG Multitool Pliers - PowerAssist Multi Tool Pocket Knife and Utility Tool Set w/ 16 Lightweight Specialty Tools and EDC Sheath
feature_bullets: 16 HAND TOOLS IN 420 STAINLESS STEEL: The loadout for this EDC outdoor multitool, camping multitool and hiking multitool includes pliers, screwdrivers, bottle and can openers, even a blasting cap crimper
2X PLIERS POWER W/ PATENTED COMPOUND LEVERAGE: A tough and lightweight multi-tool knife, tool kit and survival kit in one; this powerhouse pocket multitool cuts, crimps and tightens twice as easy

EDC MULTITOOL SHEATH IN BALLISTIC NYLON: Use your everything tool with tools for work in the warehouse, office or home; or go backpacking, fishing and camping with this everyday carry multitool with sheath
2 ONE-HAND OPEN MULTITOOL POCKET KNIFE 2.75 INCH BLADES: SOG Assisted Tech powers 1 straight edge and 1 serrated blade; no more broken nails getting your multitool pocket knife open
A SOG MULTITOOL FOR LIFE: Take care of your multitools and we’ll take care of you; we gladly consider repairs and replacements for properly maintained SOG gear

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
